alert.note: Alert for Harney County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 18 at 9:54AM PST until January 21 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST FRIDAY... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, an extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than 1/4 mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Harney County. Fog has been reported especially dense this morning along US 20 east of Burns. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Friday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. Visibility should improve this afternoon but dense fog may return tonight. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. An Air Stagnation Advisory concerns itself with meteorological conditions only. For more information on air pollution in Oregon, visit website www.oregon.gov/deq. If possible, reduce or eliminate activities that contribute to air pollution, such as outdoor burning, and the use of residential wood burning devices. Reduce vehicle trips and vehicle idling as much as possible.
